item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:44, topic:269954”]it makes sense, for fucks sake you are dumb

i think you are more stupid than a moparscaper, but in reality you arent even that intelligent[/quote]

Now that you’ve clarified it by example, it makes sense in that context. Without that clarification, it makes absolutely no sense.

You’re slowly getting better at “guru” statement conversion. It’s a nasty habit to break especially when you have moparisthebest flunkies willing to overlook it for your approval. I’m almost proud of you.

EDIT:
If you don’t hang onto that moparscaper meme tightly enough, it will get away from you. I just thought I’d let you know in case you were thinking about using it less.

item.title: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

To who frank_? To you? To me?

That would be an example of a “guru” statement. It can lead anywhere. You made some progress combating that ignorant mindset with a recent post on Taharok’s Bezier Spline thread, but judging by the frequency you make semi content rich posts, I wouldn’t be surprised if this thread had something to do with it.

I make “guru” statements too, though. When I said I knew enough to make a standalone packet bot, I didn’t indicate any features. That statement could lead anywhere. To be more specific, I meant I have analyzed the client enough to make a character login.

item.title: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

Hi BAsh,

I agree with you on the majority of those points, which is why I said I was starting to believe that this would be better as an extension to modern bytecode bots.

A mere extension is not what I had in mind when I started this thread, so I’m thinking the best path to take would be a completely standalone packet bot. At least you’d be able to run quite a few bots before getting banned.

I guess it basically comes down to sticking with the true strength of a packet bot: minimizing resource consumption. Bots like RSBot make it kind of pointless to do anything otherwise.

[quote=“frank_, post:30, topic:269954”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=356325.msg2728952#msg2728952 date=1238556026]
Puh-leeze.

It wouldn’t matter when those posts were dated. You’d still make a fuss. It just so happens that there’s a very recent thread in which you accused him of rep sharing.
[/quote]i also accused rictoo of rep sharing after i had +repped him, big whoop

[quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=356325.msg2728952#msg2728952 date=1238556026]
I wouldn’t approach the problem like that.

Stop trying to back frank_ up.
[/quote]because you are an idiot.

lawl isnt backing me up, hes just pointing out flaws that you seem to think do not exist[/quote]

That wasn’t a flaw. That was a badly stated problem in which he gave me very little room to provide a solution.

Read full topic

item.source: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape

item.title: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

At this point, I think a packet based proxy bot is well within reach. I've given it some thought, and I came up with a few benefits: 1.) Client footprint would be minimal (very little bytecode engineering... if any). 2.) Random event detection would be flawless. 3.) Easier to maintain in the long run. 4.) Can be designed to be absolutely undetectable, since we're operating at the packet level. That's all I can really think of off the top of my head, but there are probably a ton more benefits.
1.) You still have to load and run the client and that takes up resources. 2.) You can already write flawless anti-randoms with the right hooks. The reason why they aren't flawless in RSBot is because people are too lazy to write them properly. (Not sure if this is still relevant but we now have 'client script' running. The states of which weren't hooked before and needs to be for perfect anti-randoms). What you are proposing to do is exactly the same but on the byte level before the client has a chance to unpack it and store it in its internal structures. That requires you to understand the communication to the client while an easier way would be to simply rip it out of the client's memory. 3.) See 2. I would like to add that if jagex changes the protocol even slightly then it would break everything. If you simply read the client's variables some hooks will break but the majority will still work. 4.) It can't be designed to be undetectable. The only exception to this is if you build a packet bot as opposed to a packet proxy bot. Either option is infeasible. If you use a proxy bot there will be information that won't match up. To be honest while I've deobbed a client and mucked around with it a bit I've never actually understood how it runs but what little knowledge I do have should be sufficient. Assume you send a packet to the server saying you clicked on a specific object. Everything is fine. Then the server asks the client for some information. Lets say the number of times the mouse has been clicked or if the object is on screen or the number of actions taken place or a large number of other things. Sure you could modify the responses as well but then you start making a packet bot as opposed to a packet proxy bot and that is much harder.

Regardless of what form this packet based bot takes… it would require an incredible amount of effort and every revision that jagex released would require effort as well. Much simpler to follow rsbot and actually run the client. Let it do the donkey work which you know for a fact is undetectable in terms of internal state and packet parsing and then just rip the information out of its fields however you wish to go about that.

Read full topic
item.source: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape

item.title: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:26, topic:269954”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=356325.msg2728931#msg2728931 date=1238554753]
I’ll give you this… when you want a thread derailed, you know how to get the job done.
[/quote]its your useless thread, i dont care

look at the dates of those quotes, retard. is there seriously something wrong with you? when i ported the winterlove rs2 server to rsc i didnt understand binary arithmetic or networking or threads. you can learn a hell of a lot in 2 years[/quote]

Puh-leeze.

It wouldn’t matter when those posts were dated. You’d still make a fuss. It just so happens that there’s a very recent thread in which you accused him of rep sharing.

“you can learn a hell of a lot in 2 years”
…including bad habits.

[quote=“la­wl, post:27, topic:269954”]i love how you mentioned that it will be easier to maintain in the long run even though you would need to manually update the packets every week

dont even suggest making something to find out the new packet ids based on structure because its too unreliable and the packets change pretty often in structure as well[/quote]
I wouldn’t approach the problem like that.

Stop trying to back frank_ up.

Read full topic

item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

“just use ms word and spam shift+f7” - unlimitedorb on creating posts

ps:

You presumably know more about the rs client than I ever will because you believe you have spent more time with it. Simple as that. The fact of the matter is, you really have spent more time with it. That being said, who’s the real idiot in the grand scheme of things?[/quote]judging from the failure to convey any sort of point, you would appear to be the real idiot

What’s wrong with io9? It just so happens that you’ve taken the liberty to explain that for me:

[quote=“io9, post:1, topic:58229”]How do you guys get all the information on like what array is what and shit in the RS client. Like how do you find out whether aa.r is the NPC index, or whether the bb.ca array is your STats?

Thank’s in advance gais.
~io9[/quote]

[quote=“frank_, post:10, topic:58229”][quote author=ilyaostr9 link=topic=83445.msg901278#msg901278 date=1171511365]
Could you guys go a bit more specific on this, like, isn’t there a program you can run your client thorugh and It’ll strip it out.
[/quote]yes, we write our own, thats one of the good things about thise phase of cheating, everyone is being selfish and not sharing any information, so you have to learn by yourself[/quote]

How do you figure out?

^^ ILL GIV U FREE ROONSCPE GEEPEES IF YOU SHR

I’ll give you this… when you want a thread derailed, you know how to get the job done.

item.title: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:21, topic:269954”]because i communicate concisely doesnt mean that my english skills are sub-par (your use of a thesaurus makes you a fucking idiot btw)

i know more about the rs client than you ever will, that said, some of my knowledge is likely to be dated because i have little interest any more given the current attitudes of people. you being the perfect example, get a clue before you go and write a wall of text that does not provide any information

i would go get a list of quotes of you out of context but it would be a complete waste of space because all of your posts are pointless and contain at least 200 words of useless waffle[/quote]

To be honest, I didn’t use a Thesaurus for any of these posts. Your even suggesting that gives me a bit more insight into what you know.

There is a distinction between communicating “concisely” and effectively. I don’t think you understand that concept.

You presumably know more about the rs client than I ever will because you believe you have spent more time with it. Simple as that. The fact of the matter is, you really have spent more time with it. That being said, who’s the real idiot in the grand scheme of things?

You brought up a very interesting point, though. Why would I write a “wall of text” full of fluff? I think that’s a fundamental difference between us. When I look at a “long” post, I don’t see it as a “wall”. I see it as someone who is trying as hard as possible to make certain nobody has to go through the same process that compelled them to write it in the first place. It’s also a good gauge of how much time a person is willing to invest.

io9:

I agree with the above post wholeheartedly

Seriously though… if you have something like that agreeing with you? You need to take a moment to examine your position.

Read full topic
item.source: Constructing a packet bot for Runescape
